career.text:
After my internship semester at Inform GmbH, I continued my work as a frontend developer there in the form of a student job until now.
Now, after successfully completing my bachelor's degree in computer science (grade 1.6) at the University of Applied Sciences Aachen, I am ready to take the next step and am looking forward to gaining more experience in the industry.

skills.text1:
As a junior frontend developer, I apply the theoretical principles of functional design to make complex user interfaces easy to understand and straightforward. I have already developed user interfaces in C++ (at Inform), C# (in Unity projects), Qt (for my bachelor practice project), dart (for my own flutter app) and JavaScript with Vue (for an interdisciplinary project and my portfolio website), as well as other general basics during my studies with HTML, php and SQL.
My time at Inform GmbH has given me experience for everyday working life, dealing with large code solutions and designing business software, with a greater focus on compact design and workflow.
skills.text2: I work in a structured manner and approach complex tasks with well thought-out planning before implementation. I am adaptive and motivated to develop solutions as part of a team. As a front-end developer, I have already gained positive professional experience working with back-end developers. I am happy to contribute my own ideas that have already improved projects while always leaving final decisions to the team or supervisors. In addition to German, I am also fluent in English and can create documentation and designs in both languages, as well as give presentations and hold in-depth discussions.
